wikipedia_page.main: Cliff R. Stroud (7 November 1920 – 23 April 2015) was an English international lawn and indoor bowler.

link_mentions.page: Lawn bowls at the 1970 British Commonwealth Games
response: |8 || align="left"| Cliff Stroud, Harry Powell, Norman Hook, Bobby Stenhouse                || 13 || 6 || 1 || 6 || 13 || +15

Line won the fours gold medal with Norman King, Cliff Stroud and Ted Hayward at the 1972 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Worthing. Four years later he won two more medals; a bronze medal in the fours with John C Evans, Bill Irish and Tommy Armstrong and a silver medal in the team event (Leonard Cup).
| align=center| Peter Line, Ted Hayward Cliff Stroud, Norman King
He won a gold medal in the fours with Cliff Stroud, Ted Hayward and Peter Line at the 1972 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Worthing.
He won a gold medal in the fours with Norman King, Cliff Stroud and Peter Line at the 1972 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Worthing.

link_mentions.page: England at the 1970 British Commonwealth Games

response: He represented England in the rinks (fours), at the 1970 British Commonwealth Games in Edinburgh, Scotland with Harry Powell, Bobby Stenhouse and Cliff Stroud.
He represented England in the rinks (fours), at the 1970 British Commonwealth Games in Edinburgh, Scotland with Norman Hook, Bobby Stenhouse and Cliff Stroud.
